quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Everybody! Everybody! Listen up, I need your ideas, now! Ideas please, right now! Go! Go! Come on!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Michael we don't know what you're talking about...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Wet cement, outside. It's drying fast, come on. This is a lifelong dream. What do I write? What do I write?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Michael you could put your initials in it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: M.G.S.? No. Some idiot named Mark Greg Sputnik will claim credit for it. I don't...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yeah that's true.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Once in a lifetime opportunity people! Come on, here we go!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: We-- we--

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Here we go!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Well--

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Let's, yes?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: When I was a little girl...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Okay... Okay, do it! Go on! Great! Let's hear it!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: We-we found some wet cement in the park...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: It's drying, it's drying...

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: In our neighborhood...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Alright, hablbelah, come on, Phyl!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: What did we write?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Ahh come on!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Here it is, you should draw a picture...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Cause that says, that says...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: So much more than words...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No!! Come on, gimme something good!

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Ok, ok, I was watching E!, and I saw Will Smith outside the Chinese Theater, and omhmygod, he looked so good...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Pam, translate.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: She's talking about the handprints that celebrities make in the cement.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I love it!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: If you were a real star you would put your face in it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I love it more!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Michael that doesn't seem... safe.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I... love it!! Haha, come on!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Come on! [Kevin and Dwight laugh and follow Michael]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: We are here today, not to immortalize a man, but an idea... Maybe the idea of a man.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [with petroleum jelly on his face] Hurry, please.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Greatness is only skin deep, some people say...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Can you breathe?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Well that's not true. Other people believe it's deeper inside...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Hold your breath.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: And in this case...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Ready?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: That's also not true.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: And... go. [Michael sticks his face in the cement] Force it in as deep as you can.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [muffled] That's what she said.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Today is a very special day for me. And it's really not about me, it's about my grandkids, it's about my great grandkids... I can come back here when I'm 100, and I can find that piece of cement and say, "That's me. Look kids, your daddy left that face hole..." I dunno, it's a good feeling.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: [playing with Madlibs] Okay, adjective...

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Um... tall. No, no, uh, nice.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Good one. Okay, you ready?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Mmhmm.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: [reads] The tall man entered the nice building to visit a very nice man. "Sit down, Mr. Smith, can I interest you in any good... cat food?"

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: [laughing] It's a man eating cat food.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: What about a cat eating man food?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Andy and Angela seem very happy... I hope nothing horrible ever happens to them.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [wearing glasses] Um... yeah, I slept over at a, uh, friend's house and, I forgot my contact solution, so... I had to wear my backup glasses... Shut up.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: All right, everybody... Oh my God, Pam, those make you look so ugly. Um, Pam, in order to get hotter, you take the glasses off. You're moving in the wrong direction...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I don't have my contacts...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Ub, dub dah, don't need, I can't even hear you. It's just noise coming out of an ugly scientist. Um, everybody, we're going to have a little brainstorming session in the conference room.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Ener-gize...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: You know what would energize me? If you, Pamela Morgan Beesly...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Don't, don't--

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Would...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: If you propose to me during a Michael meeting, I will say no.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Well, it's too late, because I'm proposing... that you get me a cup of coffee, which would energize me greatly, and make me the happiest man in the world.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Everybody, so how are we going to energize our office? I mean, I haven't done anything since Christmas. Pam, clearly, has just given up trying. So what we need to do is we get things going, we need to get percolating a little bit. Anybody have any ideas of what we could do. Any suggestions? Yes, Andy?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: What if we changed our outgoing answering machine message, so it just had a little more... zing, and a little more pep?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Zing and pep, see that's those are the kind of words we're looking for. Yes, Jim?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: What about if we did an even newer voicemail message that had even more zing and pep?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Now we're cooking. I like this. Maybe a whole theme, like a rap. A rap rhyme...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: An urban thing...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: An urban, yeah, Stanley? You wanna help us out with that?... Stanley, earth to Stanley...

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Not me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yes you. Come on, Stanley, put your little game down and join the group.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Stanley, we're havin a little...

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Leave me alone, dammit.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: We're havin a little brainstorm session...

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: DID I STUTTER?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: ...Good, this is good. I'm going to grab a glass of water.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Can I talk to you a second?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Ugh, what?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Uh, I really think that you need to address what happened with Stanley this morning...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: What are you blabbering about? Nothing happened.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Well, you know, Stanley was openly insubordinate.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: That? In the conference room?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: We were joshin around, the two of us, and he said "did I stutter," and I said "wha-wha-wha-wha-what, dawg?" It was joking, Toby, alright?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: He didn't seem like he was joking.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Well you don't get it, because Stanley is a beautiful, sassy, powerful black man, and you're... you. If you had any friends, you would understand. Friends joke with one another: "Hey um, you're poor." "Well hey, you're mama's dead." That's what friends do. It's... you're so white.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Alright... Well, um, if you really believe that Stanley was joking...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Mmhmm.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Um, why don't you go ask him that?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Okay, I will... I'm not feeling very well right now though. My stomach hurts, so I may be going home early today, but...

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: You know, Michael, sometimes my daughter's stomach hurts when there's a mean girl at school...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Well sometimes my stomach hurts when you come into my office, so it's probably psychological.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: You meet a lot of ladies driving an Xterra, because you pull up to a stoplight, and look over and there's an Xterra next to you. They're always driven by chicks, so there's your icebreaker.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [kicks the car] Unh! Scratch.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: That's a racing stripe.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Uh, bumper's sagging.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Mmm, I doubt that very much.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: This car's crap. I will buy it for next to nothing.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: How next to?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Well, here are your options: you can sell it for parts, drive it off a cliff... you can donate it to a person that you'd like to see die in a car crash, or, you can sell it to me, and I'll use it as I would a wagon on my farm. It will be towed by a donkey.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I have to pick one of those?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Can you go over those options again?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: You know what? You knock $1500 of the price right now, and I will take it off your hands. It's gotta be now.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Well I have the, the blue book value...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Seal the deal. Let's do it. Let's do this thing. Three, two, one--

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Can I think about it?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Five, four, three, two...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Let me think about it--

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Now. Now. Now.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Let me think about it--

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Say it. Do it. Now.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I'm thinking about it--

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Do it now.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Thinking--

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Do it. Shake my hand. You will sell me this car. Shake my hand.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Yeah. All right!

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: What.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I, uh, see that you... gave me that form that I asked you to give me, Stanley the manly, so thank you for that. I guess we are back to normal.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: What are you talking about?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Well, you know, uh, the thing that you said earlier, that you didn't mean, um, and that I forgive you for. The whole thing's silly, isn't it? Friends don't need to apologize to friends as far as I'm concerned, so we are cool.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: I am not going to apologize to you.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: It's like I used to tell my wife, I do not apologize unless I think I'm wrong, and if you don't like it you can leave. And I say the same thing to my current wife, and I'll say it to my next one too.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Jim is in charge of Stanley only in sales-related matters, hence the green line--green for money-sales, get it?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Uh huh...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: There is this yellow zigzag that does give Ryan the authority to discipline Stanley...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Great

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: However, in so doing, it zigs past your name, hence zagging you and making you appear weak. Thus the yellow color. Yellow for cowardly.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: What's the pink?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Menstrual cycles.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Ok... Is there anybody up here, anybody at all, that can deal with this?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: You.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Other than me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Well, there is the emergency disaster mode for the org chart. This gives me full authority over every single person in the office.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I never said you could do that.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: All you have to do it say it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Just say it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Okay, I will think about it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Say it. Just do it. Don't think, say it. Do it. Five, four, three, two... do it. Give me control. Michael... I promise to give authority back to you when this crisis is over. Do it, Michael. Do it. Hey, this office needs a strong man. Say it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: So... All right, well, you're gonna have to deal with this yourself.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Hey Pam, I really like your glasses.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Oh, thanks.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: All the girlfriends that I've ever had have worn glasses.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Oh, okay...

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Yeah, it's kind of a turn-on for me actually...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I should probably get back to...

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Like librarians.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Entering the....

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Could you just say, "these are due back Thursday"?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: No. [Kevin leaves; Pam takes off her glasses; phone rings] Dunder Mifflin, this is Pam. Okay, go ahead. [puts a notepad close to her face and writes message]

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: A lot of jazz cats are blind, but they can play the piano like nobody's business. I'd like to put the piano in front of Pam without her glasses and see what happens. I'd also like to see her topless.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Mike.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: I'm very busy here, man.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Darryl, [clears throat] have you ever been in a gang?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Why?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: It's an advice question, and if you don't wanna talk about it, I completely understand. It's, um...

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: No, no, no...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I know, it's very, very personal...

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: No, um... I have.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I knew it. Okay, who we talking about here? Crips? Bloods?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Both.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: God.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Yeah them, and the Latin Kings... the Warriors...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Newsies.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Okay, so dig this: you're on the street, and one of your gang disses you.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Oh my goodness.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yeah, right, so what do you do to get them to make it right?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Well see, um... in the gang world, we use something called Fluffy Fingers.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: What is that?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: That's when somebody really gets in your face, you know, you just... start tickling them.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Really?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Yeah, and then he starts tickling you. You know, pretty soon you're laughing and hugging. Before you know it, you've forgotten the whole thing. Ya'll can just go to church together... get an ice cream cone.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I would've never thought that gangs would be tickling each other.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Well, it's effective.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: [to Toby] I think it's self-explanatory. [to Jim] Hey, Jim, come here for a second. Can you answer me something, as, as a true Eagles fan?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh boy...

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: How do you live with a franchise this bad?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: On a wing and a prayer, mostly.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Alright, whatever you say. Uh, listen, while I have you here with Toby, I need to give you a formal warning about your job performance.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: A formal warning... [chuckles]

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: It's actually not a joke. I know how you spend your time here, and I know how little you care about your job. And honestly if you spent as much time selling as you do goofing around with Dwight and hanging out at reception, we wouldn't be having this conversation.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [stammers] I'm sorry, is, is this because I talked to Wallace about your website? Because I really didn't mean to go over your head.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: This is nothing to do with that, alright? I always appreciate constructive criticism about my job performance. I thrive on it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I'm sorry, then do you mind explaining a little better? Cause I'm not sure what's really...

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Woah, don't get all defensive, alright? It's just a warning. If you want the details, Toby can provide them. You take it easy, alright?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: I'd say all the goofing around at Pam's desk, and, and hanging out with Pam, has finally caught up to him... w-with Pam

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Hey, what happened? What did Ryan want?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh we were just... talking about, bureaucratic stuff...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Because you're very important?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yeah...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [washing the Xterra] Rocka doopa deepa do POW! Shacka do DO! Oh! What's Dwight up to? Oh probably nothing. Racka do do dee do-do do-do! Sha-KA!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: What the hell is this all about? [holds up flier] You're flipping my car for profit.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: It's my car now.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I gave you a deal... based on what you said to me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Yeah, well... seller beware. Now if you'll excuse me, I've got to monitor a three-way bidding war for my car on eBay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I've got a Madlib for you: a stupid, idiotic, numbskull named Andy Bernard sold his Xterra to a smart and capable man named Dwight. This is shaping up to be an awesome day for Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Okay, everybody, shh! So, earlier today, Stanley sassed me, and Toby gave me some suggestions on how to discipline him. They did not work, obviously, because they were stupid, so I am now going to fake fire him.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: What does that mean?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: It's like a mock execution.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: That's not a good idea.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yes it is a good idea. It's the only possible solution I have left.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Well, you can actually fire him.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, okay... I've had enough of you.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Why are you telling us this?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Because I want you to behave as if I'm actually firing him, Oscar, okay?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Michael, if you hadn't told us this, then we would've thought that you were actually firing him.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I'm not firing him. I'm not, I need you to act like I am firing him. Just, what I'm going to do, is I'm going to pretend that I am firing him, and I need you to act like I am firing him. Do you get that? Do you get it? I'm teaching him a lesson. He needs to learn humility, alright? That's all I'm, okay, here he comes. Let's just... play act. [Stanley enters the room] Stanley, may I talk to you for a second?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Stanley Hudson, you are fired.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Are you serious?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I am serious, we are all serious. You are fired like a heart attack.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: You're firing me over three words. Have you lost your mind? Do you think I'm gonna let you do this to me?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hmm.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: I've watched you screw up this office for ten years, and I'm filing a lawsuit, and I'm gonna tell them about every stupid thing you've ever done up in this office.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Alright alright, okay, you know what? Now you know how I feel. This was a fake firing. Lesson learned. Good work, everybody. Very nice.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: So I'm not fired.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: That's it. And uh... do you have anything to say to me?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Oh yes, I do. You are out of your damn, little pea-sized, mind. What is wrong with you? Do you have any sense? At all?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Okay...

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Do you have any idea how to run an office?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Every day you do something stupider than you did the day before.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: That's not-

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: And I think, "there's no possible way--

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: All right, all right...

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: He can top that."

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: But what do you do?! You find a way, dammit, to top it! You are professional idiot!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hey, STOP IT! Okay, everybody out.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Who?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Everybody, except Stanley.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Let's go.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I can't find my glasses.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Okay, you know what? Why don't you take my hand, and leave them, and let's get out of here.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Okay, okay.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: [chuckling] It's Michael versus Stanley, and it is the clash of the titans. In one corner, you have Michael, and he is mad. And then, in the other corner, you have Stanley, and he's mad. So that's about it!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [starts to cry] I don't understand why you keep picking on me.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Oh, for the love of God.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You just, do, and I don't know why, so... please help me understand.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Fine. Here it is: you are a person I do not respect. The things you say, your actions, your methods, and style. Everything you would do, I would do it the opposite way.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Well Stanley, maybe you're feeling that you don't respect me because you don't know me very well.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Michael I have known you a very long time, and the more I've gotten to know you, the less I've come to respect you. Any other theories?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: All right, you don't respect me. I accept that. But listen to me, you can't talk to me that way in this office, you just can't. I am your boss. Can't allow it.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Fair enough.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I am good person, and sometimes, good people don't get no respect. Rodney Dangerfield. [as Rodney Dangerfield] Hey, I don't get no respect. No respect at all. When I was in the sandbox as a kid, I got not respect. My wife likes to talk after sex, so she called me from a hotel room, and said, "I don't respect you!" Ahh, thoughtless. Aw, you know what don't get no respect? Airplane food. Why don't they just make the plane out of the airline food? My wife don't get no respect, some--take her, please, for example. [as Jeff Foxworthy] If you don't get no respect, you might be redneck. [as Borat] Respect is niiice. Borat. [as Rodney Dangerfield] What's the deal with Grapenuts? No grapes, no nuts. I don't get no respect!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: So I'm thinking, as a reward for our loyal clients, that we contact their assistants, and we find out where they live. And then, we go to their houses, in the middle of the summer, and go caroling. It is a summer Christmas sale-abration. And we call it, a summer sales-a-lot. Feedback? Anybody? Stanley?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Has potential to be your best idea yet. [Michael smiles]

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: That's the dumbest thing I ever heard. [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Dammit, Phyllis. Alright, everybody out except Phyllis.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You know, I don't care what he did to me.  He's mean to other people, that's what gets me.  He's just...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Who else is he mean to?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Everybody.  He just, he's always, he's always talking about people behind their backs to me.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: What kind of stuff does Stanley say?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Like that people are stupid, and that they're idiots, and that they're sluts.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Why would he say that?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Because he's mean.  He's, he's like a really mean-spirited guy.  He talks about how gay Oscar is...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Mm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: And that Angela's a midget, and that [indicates Jim] your chin is too big.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I know, I know.  I think it's tiny.  I think it's too small if anything.  And that your glasses make you look ugly.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: She's never worn these glasses before.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Well, he's just mean.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Michael, I think that what Stanley did to you was rude.  Maybe you should just get him aside and tell him that he was behaving badly.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: It's complicated, Pam.  I mean, the world looks a lot easier from behind your reception desk.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Well, I actually agree with her, I think you should talk to him.  And you also might want to explain to Andy that no one wants to help him decide whether or not he has a rash.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Oh, yeah, and then, yell at Creed, because you know what?  Looking can be as bad as touching.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I put Stanley on a pedestal, for a long time.  But sometimes he can just be a big, fat jerk.  I... jerks don't deserve to be on pedestals.  Jerks should be placed up somewhere where everybody can see how jerky they are.  Big marble... jerk stand.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Pam, stand up.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Hi everyone.  My name is Pam, and I wear glasses.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Hi, Pam.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Pretty disgusting.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: I like your frames.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Thanks, Phyllis.  Yours, too.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Oh, well, I'm already married.  Boys don't make passes at girls who wear glasses.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Ignore her, those glasses are so cool.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Really?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Yeah, you look like Lisa Loeb or Tina Fey or someone.  You should definitely wear them all the time.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Huh.  Maybe I will.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Guess who just became the cutest girl in the office.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: What's it like without my glasses?  Um, well, here, I'll show you.  Unfocus your lens.  A lot.  I'm 20/400.  You got it?  Okay, I'm gonna spend the rest of the day like this.  I can't see any of the things that would bother me on a normal day.  I can't see anything disgusting, or ugly, or Michael... it's great.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Yo!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Hi, can I help you?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Haha, nice!  I guess I have been a stranger lately.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [pointing] Ryan!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Hey, Pam, do you want a bagel? [throws it]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Think fast. [it hits her in the face] Honestly, Pam, the bagels in New York are the only good bagels in the world, I swear to God.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: The only good bagels anywhere.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I've heard that. [reaches down to pick up bagel from the floor]

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Same with coffee, and women.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: I'm gonna go find Toby.  Oh, here's what you do.  [takes her bagel] You scoop out the middle, like that, and then you just eat the shell.  You know? [pats his belly, points to Pam]  Fewer carbs.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yeah, if I could have seen what he just did, I think I would have gotten angry.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: A formal warning, seriously?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Well, as you know, Dwight has filed a lot of complaints against you over the years.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: And no one cared.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: But now it's being looked at as more of a productivity issue.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Productivity?  My numbers are good.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: I know, um, but Ryan thinks that, uh, they're not good enough.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Wallace likes Jim.  So going after him - that's a risky move for me, but in business, you gotta take risks.  Sometimes you gotta get out on the open highway, with the top down [pushes button about eight times to get the top down.  Finally it comes down and it's all bunched up.  As he's fixing it, the car rolls backwards a bit.]
